normalised: five g Rollout Gains Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide 5G rollout continues apace, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio expanding their networks across major Indian cities. Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) officials confirmed that the rollout is on track to meet the projected targets for 2024.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide five g rollout continues apace, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio expanding their networks across major Indian cities. T R A I officials confirmed that the rollout is on track to meet the projected targets for two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Jio announced the successful completion of 5G trials in several rural districts of Uttar Pradesh, utilizing indigenous technology developed in partnership with IIT Madras. Airtel reported significant network enhancements in Mumbai and Chennai, promising users peak download speeds exceeding 1 Gbps.
normalised: Jio announced the successful completion of five g trials in several rural districts of Uttar Pradesh, utilizing indigenous technology developed in partnership with I I T Madras. Airtel reported significant network enhancements in Mumbai and Chennai, promising users peak download speeds exceeding one G b p s.

unnormalised: "We are committed to connecting every village and town," stated Mr. Sharma, a senior executive at Jio, during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs on 26/10/2023. Airtel aims to cover all major metros by 31/12/2023.
normalised: "We are committed to connecting every village and town," stated Mister Sharma, a senior executive at Jio, during a press conference held at eleven hundred hours on twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty three. Airtel aims to cover all major metros by thirty first December two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: Analysts estimate that the total investment in 5G infrastructure will reach Rs. 3 lakh crore by 2025. Concerns remain regarding call drops and network stability, particularly during peak hours such as 18:00 hrs. The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is scheduled to review progress on 15/11/2023. The initial phase covers approximately 6000 km of fiber optic cable deployment.
normalised: Analysts estimate that the total investment in five g infrastructure will reach rupee three lakh crore by two thousand and twenty five. Concerns remain regarding call drops and network stability, particularly during peak hours such as eighteen hundred hours. The D o T is scheduled to review progress on fifteenth November two thousand and twenty three. The initial phase covers approximately six thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable deployment.
